result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher John Staberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
2 days credit, in the event of probation revocation. 
Sign up for probation on 10/6/22

miscConds.notes:
- $243 in Court costs payable through Clerk of Court
- $200 in DNA Surcharge payable through Clerk of Court

- In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

- DNA Sample
- Comply with Domestic Violence treatment plan
- Attend couples counseling
- AODA and follow all recommendations 
- Complete and cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS and as requested by DOC. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety 
- No abusive contact with Emily B-K
- Not to possess any dangerous weapons
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's 
- Follow all rules and regulations of agent. Pay all supervision fees.

Amended Information. bph

2:03 PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel. Attorney Aaron Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court w/defendant Christopher John Staberg. Set for ARGN. Atty Damrau notes that he has just filed the Amended Information with 3 Counts, has advised Atty Dobbe as to the 3 Counts, all misdemeanor charges. Atty Dobbe has seen an electronic version of the Information and would like to proceed with PLEAS and files plea questionnaire. State is in compliance with Victim rights, appears with Selena from Victim Witness. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Amended Ct 1 (DOC), Amended Ct 2 (Misd. Poss.THC), and Amended Ct 3 ( Misd. Battery). Court questions Defendant. Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty to the Amended Counts 1, 2, and 3. Sentencing arguments. Victim makes statements. DE makes statements. Court makes statements and orders: 
Court Orders:  S/W 2 years' probation with conditions:    
- 2 days credit in the event of revocation

Count 1: 
- Court Costs: $243.00; apply bond, balance through payment plan in place with COC
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00; apply bond, balance through payment plan in place with COC

Count 2: 
- Court Costs: $243.00 ; apply bond, balance through payment plan in place with COC  
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00; apply bond, balance through payment plan in place with COC

Count 3: 
- Court Costs: $243.00; apply bond, balance through payment plan in place with COC    
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00; apply bond, balance through payment plan in place with COC

Conditions of probation on all 3 counts: 
- Comply with D/V treatment plan
- Attend couples counseling
- AODA
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- No abusive contact with Emily B-K
- Not to possess any dangerous weapon as defined by 
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's 
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation by 9:30 am 10/6/22
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections. 

20 days to appeal. 
Adjourned:  2:28 pm

1:36 PM CO: RMW, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K Kittel.  Attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court with Defendant Christopher John Staberg. Set for MH. Court notes an Amended Information filed adding Ct 7. Atty Dobbe states the parties have reached an agreement, State will be filing another Amended Information. and asks to reset the ARGN noting possible plea. Atty Dobbe withdraws Motion to Suppress. Court confirms address of DE. Bond continues. Adjourned: 1:39 pm
Arraignment scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Arraignment on October 5, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
adding Count 7.

10:05 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court for Christopher John Staberg. Defendant Christopher John Staberg in court. ADA Damrau calls Officer Katarina Hafstad of NRPD to testify. S/T Officer Hafstad. Direct by ADA Damrau. Officer identifies Defendant. Cross by Atty Dobbe. Redirect by ADA Damrau. Recross by Atty Dobbe. Witness excused. Closing arguments. Court reviews testimony. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court will hear Arraignment on 9/29 at previously set Motion Hearing in this matter- no new notice of hearing provided. Bond continues. Adjourned at 10:24 AM.  gll
for bond modification. filed by DE. arc    per RMW amended on record on 08/11/22. arc
Preliminary hearing on September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Emily K, R.M.S and R.JS.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping. 

- Follow through on programming and adhere to invitations in and out of home upon vicitm request.

8:34 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher John Staberg in court.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court for Christopher John Staberg. Court schedules a motion hearing for motion to suppress. Atty Dobbe request to amend bond. Victim speaks to the court. Court amends bond.
Motion hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pre-trial/scheduling conference on August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

* AMENDED *

- BOND ON FILE

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Emily K, R.M.S & R.J.S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. * Phone contact with children is permitted through Holly B. Text and e-mail communication permitted to discuss finances and regarding welfare of children with Emily K. *

- May return to residence in the presence of law enforcement one time to retrieve personal belongings.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Matthew Dobbe   DF:  Christopher John Staberg appeared. Case called at 9:09 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for a status. Atty Dobbe has been appointed. Waives time limits to preliminary hearing. Court schedules. Address confirmed. ADA Brekken would like to be heard on bond. Victim is present. Gives bond argument. Victim makes statement. State does not object to bond modification for phone contact with children. Court will amend bond. Court adjourned at 9:17 a.m.  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
